title: creating titleless and non-closable bugs

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi,

I just found that it's possible to create titleless and non-closable bugs by prepending values for the 'report[title]'  and 'report[vulnerability_information]' parameters with '%00' characters respectively.

To reproduce:
- Create a baseline request via https://hackerone.com/[program]/reports/new
- Intercept said request to allow tampering using a valid session (i.e. Burp Repeater)
- Prepend the value for 'report[title]' with '%00' (creates titleless report) or;
- Prepend the value for report[vulnerability_information]' with '%00' (create non-closable report)
- View the titleless/non-closable bug reports in the queue for [program]

Regards,

-leander
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

I just found that it's possible to create titleless and non-closable bugs by prepending values for the 'report[title]' and 'report[vulnerability_information]' parameters with '%00' characters respectively.

To reproduce:

  • Create a baseline request via https://hackerone.com/%5Bprogram%5D/reports/new
  • Intercept said request to allow tampering using a valid session (i.e. Burp Repeater)
  • Prepend the value for 'report[title]' with '%00' (creates titleless report) or;
  • Prepend the value for report[vulnerability_information]' with '%00' (create non-closable report)
  • View the titleless/non-closable bug reports in the queue for [program]

Regards,

-leander

activities.message: Hi @leander - I was able to reproduce this. We'll get a fix out soon. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @leander - I was able to reproduce this. We'll get a fix out soon. Thanks!

activities.message: Thanks again for reporting this bug. We pushed a fix yesterday.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks again for reporting this bug. We pushed a fix yesterday.

activities.message: We couldn't find any serious security implications associated with this behavior, besides the minor issue that prevents a report from being closed. However, it could've introduced more serious edge cases in the future, and that's why we decided to award $150.
activities.markdown_message: We couldn't find any serious security implications associated with this behavior, besides the minor issue that prevents a report from being closed. However, it could've introduced more serious edge cases in the future, and that's why we decided to award $150.

activities.message:
Since other researchers seem to use this report as an example to file other techniques to create contentless or titleless reports, I'm following up here to add some more context around why we actually accepted this as a valid submission. 

The main reason here is that this bug actually prevented response teams from ever closing the titleless report due to a failing backend validation. A titleless or contentless report (for instance by getting creative with Markdown parsing) on its own wouldn't have qualified, it's really the ability to prevent the report from getting closed that was the underlying problem here.
activities.markdown_message:
Since other researchers seem to use this report as an example to file other techniques to create contentless or titleless reports, I'm following up here to add some more context around why we actually accepted this as a valid submission.

The main reason here is that this bug actually prevented response teams from ever closing the titleless report due to a failing backend validation. A titleless or contentless report (for instance by getting creative with Markdown parsing) on its own wouldn't have qualified, it's really the ability to prevent the report from getting closed that was the underlying problem here.
